theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The current model captures movement from periphery to core and mentorship, but it lacks explicit representation of entry, dropout, and participation dynamics central to legitimate peripheral participation. Adding mentoring capacity/load and engagement/retention mechanisms makes progression and persistence contingent on community support, not just headcount. These additions create clear feedbacks: more mentors and engagement reduce dropout and turnover, which stabilizes the core and accelerates learning.

variables.name: Newcomer Onboarding Rate
variables.description: Rate at which new participants enter the community and become New Contributors.

variables.name: New Contributor Dropout Rate
variables.description: Rate at which New Contributors leave before becoming Experienced Contributors.

variables.name: Community Mentoring Capacity
variables.description: Aggregate capacity (hours/attention) available for mentoring from Core Developers and Experienced Contributors.

variables.name: Mentoring Demand from Newcomers
variables.description: Mentoring demand driven by the number of New Contributors and their needs.

variables.name: Mentoring Saturation
variables.description: Degree to which mentoring demand exceeds capacity (e.g., demand/capacity); higher saturation implies overload.

variables.name: Community Engagement Level
variables.description: Overall engagement and sense of belonging that supports participation and persistence.

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: The model includes socialization (mentorship) and references explicit knowledge, but lacks an explicit knowledge stock and the externalization/decay dynamics. Adding an explicit knowledge stock with creation and decay flows operationalizes externalization and combination, while connecting accessibility to learning and promotion captures internalization. This completes the SECI spiral and links documentation dynamics to developer progression and stability.

variables.name: Project's Explicit Knowledge
variables.description: Codified knowledge assets (docs, contributor guides, ADRs) available to the community.

variables.name: Documentation Creation Rate
variables.description: Rate at which new explicit knowledge is externalized and added to the project corpus.

variables.name: Documentation Decay Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge becomes obsolete or inaccurate.

variables.name: Externalization Effectiveness
variables.description: Effectiveness of converting tacit knowledge (from practice/mentorship) into high-quality documentation.

variables.name: Project Change Intensity
variables.description: Overall pace of codebase/process change that drives documentation obsolescence.

variables.name: Knowledge Integration Quality
variables.description: Quality of organizing, integrating, and curating explicit knowledge to make it usable.
